instructions: Tap the Settings app. Tap Accessibility . Tap Voice Control . Select Set Up Voice Control . The next screen shows an overview of things you can do with Voice Control. Select Continue . Tap Done to enable Voice Control. When Voice Control is on, an icon appears at the top of the screen.

Open Settings . Select Accessibility . Tap Voice Control . Tap Customize Commands . You'll see the available categories of commands that Voice Control supports. Select one to see the specific commands. Tap a command to see its options screen. Set the toggle switch to disable the command. This screen also shows the phrases that activate this option. Turn on Confirmation Required if you want to confirm a command before Voice Control makes it. Repeat these steps for every command you want to modify in Voice Control.
